Intervention: Anemic breast cancer participants received epoetin beta (NeoRecormon®) at a dose of 30000 International Units (IU) as subcutaneous (SC) injection once every week for a total of 12 weeks. Adjustments in the dose were implemented based on the participant's blood hemoglobin levels.
Eligibility: Adult female participants with histological diagnosis of breast cancer
Any type of chemotherapy planned for greater than or equal to (>/=) 9 weeks
Hemoglobin level less than (<) 11 grams per deciliter (g/dL)
Participants able to receive iron supplement, if necessary
Known or suspected contraindications to epoetin beta
Diagnosis of anemia only due to iron-deficiency
Blood transfusion or treatment with any erythropoietic factor within 4 weeks before study start
Results: Percentage of Participants With Response to Treatment Based on Hemoglobin Levels

Response was defined as increase of hemoglobin levels by at least 2 grams per deciliter (g/dL) as compared to baseline or the achievement of hemoglobin level of 12 g/dL after 12 weeks of treatment in the absence of red blood cells transfusion.

Arm/Group Description: Anemic breast cancer participants received epoetin beta (NeoRecormon  ) at a dose of 30000 International Units (IU) as subcutaneous (SC) injection once every week for a total of 12 weeks. Adjustments in the dose were implemented based on the participant's blood hemoglobin levels.
Unit of Measure: percentage of participants  46.2        (38.2 to 54.3)
